fields.headline: Newsbytes
fields.bodyText: UMPC for nurses Motion Computing, the NHS and others have been testing the world's first/only MCA or "mobile clinical assistant" - a sealed, disinfectable Windows-based ultramobile Tablet PC targeted at the health care industries. · motioncomputing.com The lady is for Turing After 40 years, IBM's Frances Allen has become the first woman to receive computing's highest honour, the AM Turing Award. · awards.acm.org Photographic milestone Canon has launched an advanced 10 megapixel digital SLR, the EOS-1D Mark III, marking 20 years of EOS systems. · canon.co.uk Bluetooth luggable France's Sagem thinks it has launched the world's smallest Bluetooth earpiece. The H4 measures 35 x 18 x 12.5mm, weighs 8g and costs €79 "which equates to 53 of your great British pounds". · sagem.com Photoscreens for walls FotoInsight is offering to turn your family snaps into art by printing them on wood-framed canvas using fade-resistant "archival" inks - just in time for Mother's Day. · photo-canvas-printing.co.uk Google Apps for cash Google is now offering a Premier Edition of its online applications - such as Gmail and Calendar - to businesses for $50 (£25) per user account a year. · google.com Online Statesmanship New Statesman has opened nominations for its 2007 New Media Awards, which "celebrate UK new media projects that benefit society, government or democracy". · newstatesman.com · If you'd like to comment on any aspect of Technology Guardian, send your emails to tech@theguardian.com
